result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather R. Bergstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**63 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather R. Bergstrom

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant with DNA form.
Same as Complaint, just removing Enhancer of possession on or near certain places.

(2:02 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Heather R. Bergstrom appeared by video, in custody in the Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Heather R. Bergstrom.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
State advises the Information will be similar to the complaint just removing an enhancer from Count 2.
Defendant is willing to proceed without the Information on file, knowing the State will be filing the Information.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Court advises even though the case isn't a Branch 4 case, will transfer the case and take the plea.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Possession of Methamphetamine as a Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 21 months with the following conditions:
180 days jail concurrent to Clark County case 19CF130. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge to include court costs which includes a bench warrant fee. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. No contact with any known drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. Not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 63 days credit if probation revoked. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Defendant's Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance

9:39 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather R. Bergstrom appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Heather R. Bergstrom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
